text: I highly recommend the Ocarina of Rhyme remix album if enjoy the Ocarina of Time soundtrack. Just look it up, you will be pleasantly surprised with what you find
author: Lightwatch

text: nearly every song in this game gave me a sense of wonder as a kid, even this one.
author: Mary Clark

text: PBG changed how I'll hear this song forever. "HEY, THIS SOLDIER IS DEAD! OH, WHAT A HAPPY DAY! hEY, THIS SOLDIER IS DEAD! i JUST WATCHED HIM DIE!"
author: The13th Rose

text: There's always a tonne of ocarina of time songs on everyone's VGM lists, no surprise, best video game soundtrack of all time in my opinion

text: great song, which game do y'all like more...ocarina of time or majora's mask?!

text: C! Oh please! Give me something with C!

text: Such a classic game! Great music throughout as well!

text: This is from Harry Potter...

text: I think you're confusing it with something else since The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time was first released in 1998 while the first Harry Potter movie didn't happen until 2001.
author: GameBeatenakaKevinS

text: Ahh, the basis for the Clock Town theme from Majora's Mask. Good to hear it again after all this time.
author: SMRPGFAN101

text:
When I was a kid and had no internet and couldn't figure out what to do I would usually hang out in Hyrule Market cause I liked the music/atmosphere. 
Strange, since in my most recent playthroughs, it seems like I'm barely there...
author: ninamorifanboi

text: Hmm...I have this song on my computer and it's just slightly faster than this video. By 0:28, the song's a second off.
author: Alexander Evans

text: I love this song and this game! :D
author: BB Games

text: Legendary track and game :)
author: Web SonoraGamers

text: Tbh, I could never get into TLoZ games. Everytime I played one it felt like I was forcing myself through it. But I've always enjoyed the music in the series.
author: Dalton McBleh

text: I'm not sure if you`ve played it, but try giving The Wind Waker a shot. It has the perfect amount of everything for a Zelda tittle for people who are getting into the series as a whole. Its not the hardest, but its also not a walk in the park. In my personal opinion, it the Zelda I recommend for anyone who is interested or starting out in the series, but that's just me! (or you might have already played the game and I 'm just sounding like a broken record, haha!)
author: Azure Alufei

text: I feel the same with a lot of games, usually western RPGs.
author: Matrilwood

text: I have Wind Waker HD, and while it is better than OoT, I still got that feeling of forced fun within myself. Maybe I just need to take the game in short bursts.
author: Dalton McBleh

text: @Dalton McBleh Not every genre fits every gamer. I love the Zelda series dearly, have played through OoT at least 6-7 times now with as much enjoyment as the last time. Other styles I cant stand, like sports games, most FPS, and any moba :P Oh, and horror games.. hate em :p
author: Jarl Lillebø

text: This doesn't feel the same without the murmurs of the crowd in the background.
author: Sunny Rustles

text: Great music.
author: William Fiuza

text: The couple in Hyrule Market like this track so much they spin-dance to it all day long. You know what I'd have liked? Right as you exit the Temple of Time for the first time as adult Link, you walk around the destroyed Hyrule Market, blown away by all the chaos... and then you notice a couple of ReDeads spin-dancing at the same spot.
author: SupraDarky

text: I thought the exact same thing as a kid, playing this game way back when
author: Everlasting

text: This is my second favorite soundtrack of the 3D Zelda games only to Twilight Princess.  It also revolutionized other games to come in the series.  I also find that this is one of Koji Kondo's greatest soundtracks during the N64 era along with Super Mario 64.
author: Eric C.

text: Yeah, but that dancing couple is still alive, right? In Kakariko.
author: Hawlo

text:
Would've been really creepy if the Redeads would've slightly resembled the town villagers, wouldn't it?
Most probably escaped (as you can see them in Kakariko and Lon Lon Ranch), but maybe not all...
author: Fak Yuh Googel

text: but... they didn't die. You can find them still dancing behind the windmill in kakariko village.
author: Florence Greyhaze

text: @Fak Yuh Googel Yep, I can totally see that in my head if some of them did turn into Redeads.

that true? 

been a while since i've played that game...didn't know the redead danced around that same spot
